title.narrative: WASH INTERVENTIONS IN COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: By 2018, 10% of the population without access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation at the national level, has a sustainable access and adopt good hygiene practices including hand washing soap, treatment and safe storage of household water., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2016 - Outcome 4 / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH): By 2016, populations in provinces with low access to potable water and basic sanitation have an improved access to these services and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities

Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, 10% of the population without access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation at the national level, has a sustainableaccess and adopt good hygiene practices including hand washing soap, treatment and safe storage of household water.

description.narrative: In 2018, 55,290 people gained access to safe drinking water and 639,990 people from the most marginalized and unserved provinces of Cibitoke (north west), Bujumbura Rural (west), Makamba and Rutana (south east), and Ruyigi and Cankuzo (east) gained access to household sanitation through community-led total sanitation supported by UNICEF Burundi. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
